de.ryanthara.ja.rycon.tools

Class LeicaGSIFileTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ryanthara.ja.rycon.tools.LeicaGSIFileTools

  • public class LeicaGSIFileTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements several basic operations on Leica GSI files.

    The Leica Geo Serial Interface (GSI) is a general purpose, serial data interface for bi-directional communication between TPS Total Stations, Levelling instruments and computers.

    The GSI interface is composed in a sequence of blocks, ending with a terminator (CR or CR/LF). The later introduced enhanced GSI16 format starts every line with a * sign.

    Since:
    1
    Version:
    2
    Author:
    sebastian

    • Method Detail

      • getFoundCodes

        public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> getFoundCodes()
        Return the found codes as TreeSet<Integer>.

        This method is necessary because of the elimination of the code in the string of the read lines.

        Return:
        found codes as TreeSet<Integer>

      • processCodeSplit

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> processCodeSplit(boolean dropCode,
                                                                                   boolean writeLinesWithoutCode)
        Splits a code based file into separate files by code.

        A separate file is generated for every existing code. Lines without code will be ignored. RyCON need a valid GSI format file with code blocks (WI 71). The block order is equal.

        Parameters:
        dropCode - if code block should dropped out of the result string
        writeLinesWithoutCode - if lines without code should be written
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> for writing

      • processFormatConversionBetweenGSI8AndGSI16

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionBetweenGSI8AndGSI16(boolean isGSI16)
        Converts a GSI file into GSI8 or GS16 format.

        Due to issues data precision is going to be lost.

        Parameters:
        isGSI16 - Output file is GSI16 format
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String> with lines of GSI8 or GSI16 format

      • processFormatConversionCSV2GSI

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionCSV2GSI(boolean isGSI16)
        Converts a CSV file (comma or semicolon separatorited) into a GSI file.

        The format of the GSI file is controlled with a parameter. The separator sign is automatically detected.

        Parameters:
        isGSI16 - control if GSI8 or GSI16 format is written
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String> with lines of GSI format

      • processFormatConversionCSVBaselStadt2GSI

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionCSVBaselStadt2GSI(boolean isGSI16)
        Converts a CSV file from the geodata server Basel Stadt (switzerland) into a GSI format file.

        With a parameter it is possible to distinguish between GSI8 and GSI16

        Parameters:
        isGSI16 - distinguish between GSI8 or GSI16
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String> with lines of text format

      • processFormatConversionGSI2CSV

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionGSI2CSV(java.lang.String separator,
                                                                            boolean writeCommentLine)
        Converts a GSI file into a comma or semicolon separatorited csv file.

        With parameter it is possible to set the separation char (comma or semicolon).

        Parameters:
        separator - separator sign as String
        writeCommentLine - if comment line should be written
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String> with lines of text format

      • processFormatConversionGSI2TXT

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionGSI2TXT(java.lang.String separator,
                                                                            boolean isGSI16,
                                                                            boolean writeCommentLine)
        Converts a GSI file into a space or tab separatorited text file.

        With parameter it is possible to set the separation char (space or tab).

        Parameters:
        separator - separator sign as String
        isGSI16 - true if GSI16 format is used
        writeCommentLine - if comment line should be written
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String> with lines of text format

      • processFormatConversionTXT2GSI

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processFormatConversionTXT2GSI(boolean isGSI16)
        Converts a text file (space or tabulator separated) into a GSI file.

        The GSI format decision is done by a parameter in the constructor.

        Parameters:
        isGSI16 - decision which GSI format is used
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<String>> with lines

      • processLevelling2Cad

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processLevelling2Cad(boolean ignoreChangePoints)
        Converts a Levelling file to a coordinate one (no, x, y, z) in GSI format for cad import.

        Within this conversation a x,y coordinate will be generated from the line number. The units are rounded down to 1/10mm.

        Parameters:
        ignoreChangePoints - if change points with number '0' has to be ignored
        Return:
        Converted ArrayList<String> for cad import

      • processTidyUp

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processTidyUp(boolean holdStations,
                                                           boolean holdControlPoints)
        Tidy up resurrection (stations) and control point measurements from files.

        RyCON has the intelligence to tidy up resurrection and control points by a given structure in the measurement file. Stations are identified by word index (WI) and the control / stake out points by order in the file and the pattern 'STKE'.

        Parameters:
        holdStations - decide to hold station lines
        holdControlPoints - decide to hold control points
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> for writing

      • blockEncoder

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<LeicaGSIFileTools.GSIBlock>> blockEncoder(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lines)
        Helper which converts String lines from ArrayList<String> into ArrayList<ArrayList<GSIBlock>>.
        Parameters:
        lines - ArrayList<String> with the lines as String to convert
        Return:
        converted ArrayList<ArrayList<GSIBlock>>

      • lineTransformation

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lineTransformation(boolean isGSI16,
                                                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<LeicaGSIFileTools.GSIBlock>> gsiBlocks)
        Transform an ArrayList<ArrayList<GSIBlock>> into an ArrayList<String>.
        Parameters:
        isGSI16 - if GSI16 format is needed
        gsiBlocks - blocks to transform
        Return:
        transformed blocks as lines of String
